course.subject: MGMT
course.name: Social Entrepreneurship and Venture Philanthropy
course.description: Social Entrepreneurship uses business methods to address social and environmental problems, often in innovative ways. Venture Philanthropy uses venture capital funding tools to promote start-up and growth of social ventures. This course combines lectures, case studies, industry expert guest speakers and project work to involve students in social entrepreneurship and venture philanthropy with real social impact as a result. Student teams work with social enterprise partners to develop a growth plan and funding proposal for grant funding to be awarded to one of the social venture partner organizations at the end of the course. The course is multi-disciplinary and open to MBAs and other PG/UG programs. (UG students please email instructor with CV and motivation letter for course admission.)

reviews.author: tucxx
reviews.title: Demanding yet rewarding
reviews.comment_content: In-depth learning about social entrepreneurship. Lots of guest speaker to share their experience. Will be teamed up with a NGO to work on a business project which is the main task of the course. Pitch for funding towards the end.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is very approachable and knowledgable. She is willing to introduce her contacts to help your team to move forward in the project. Her comments are straight to point and helpful.
reviews.comment_workload: Definitely require strong commitment to this course as it is quite demanding. You need to take initiative to build a relationship with the organisation you're collaborating with in order to succeed. Takes up a lot of time and effort with the presentations/ pitches.

reviews.author: med1ben
reviews.comment_content: Each class tackles a speaker and a topic related to social entrepreneurship, very organised and methodical approach. A class long consulting project is conducted in teams working with a social business in Hong Kong.
reviews.comment_teaching: Great teaching style, the professor speaks perfect English, and is very approachable and is dedicated to make the most out of each class. The speakers come from various roles in the social entrepreneurship sphere in Hong Kong and beyond, and aretheir talsk are often very interesting.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is split over multiple factors : attendance, participation, consulting project report and final presentation, peer evaluation.
reviews.comment_workload: The consulting project is as demanding as the student wants it to be depending on their dedication to the class.
